entry.title: Leetcode-226-Invert Binay Tree
entry.content:
Problem Description:

Invert a binary tree.

     4
   /   \
  2     7
 / \   / \
1   3 6   9

to
4
/ \
7 2
/ \ / \
9 6 3 1

题目大意：

反转一个二叉树

Solutions:

递归调用函数本身即可，注意边界条件。

Code in C++:

/**
 * Definition for a binary tree node.
 * struct TreeNode {
 *     int val;
 *     TreeNode *left;
 *     TreeNode *right;
 *     TreeNode(int x) : val(x), left(NULL), right(NULL) {}
 * };
 */
class Solution {
    public:
           TreeNode* invertTree(TreeNode* root) {
            if(!root) return root;
            if(!root->left&&!root->right) return root;
            else{
                TreeNode* teml = invertTree(root->right);
                TreeNode* temr = invertTree(root->left);
                root->left= teml;
                root->right=temr;
                return root;
                    }

            }
    };
entry.summary: Problem Description:

entry.title: Leetcode-104-Maximum Depth of Binary Tree
entry.content:
Problem Description:

Given a binary tree, find its maximum depth.

The maximum depth is the number of nodes along the longest path from the root node down to the farthest leaf node.

题目大意：

给定一个二叉树，返回它的最大深度

Solutions:

递归调用本函数，返回左右子树的最大深度中较大值+1即可。

Code in C++:

/**
 * Definition for a binary tree node.
 * struct TreeNode {
 *     int val;
 *     TreeNode *left;
 *     TreeNode *right;
 *     TreeNode(int x) : val(x), left(NULL), right(NULL) {}
 * };
 */
class Solution {
    public:
        int maxDepth(TreeNode* root) {
            if(!root) return 0;
            else
                return max(maxDepth(root->left),maxDepth(root->right))+1;

    }
};
entry.summary: Problem Description:

entry.title: Leetcode-136-Single Number
entry.content:
Problem Description:

Given an array of integers, every element appears twice except for one. Find that single one.

题目大意：

给定一个数组，其中除了某一个数字以外其他数字都出现过两次，找出这个数字。

Solutions:

这道题方法有许多，这里本文介绍最简单的一种，使用位运算，一个数字a^b^b以后仍然为它本身。这样，把整个数组^一次即可。

Code in C++:

class Solution {
    public:
        int singleNumber(vector<int>& nums) {
            int res=0;
            for(int i=0;i<nums.size();i++)
                res^=nums[i];

            return res;

        }
};
entry.summary: Problem Description:

entry.title: Leetcode-292-Nim Game
entry.content:
Problem Description:

You are playing the following Nim Game with your friend: There is a heap of stones on the table, each time one of you take turns to remove 1 to 3 stones. The one who removes the last stone will be the winner. You will take the first turn to remove the stones.

Both of you are very clever and have optimal strategies for the game. Write a function to determine whether you can win the game given the number of stones in the heap.

For example, if there are 4 stones in the heap, then you will never win the game: no matter 1, 2, or 3 stones you remove, the last stone will always be removed by your friend.

题目大意：

你和朋友玩一个取石子的游戏，每一个人可以取1-3个石子，假如你们俩都能每一步做出最优选择，那么当你先取的时候，输入一个石子数，返回你是否能取得胜利。

Solutions:

这道题仔细分析其实并不难。当石子数为4的整数倍的时候，总是后手胜利，因为不管先手拿走了n(1-3)枚石子，你总是拿走4-n枚，即可获胜，其他情况下，先手可以把自己变为后手，即取走余数。所以想通了这一点之后这道题变得非常简单。即判断先手是否胜利的条件在于石子数能否被4整除。

Code in C++:

class Solution {
    public:
        bool canWinNim(int n) {
            return n%4;
        }
};
entry.summary: Problem Description:

entry.title: Leetcode-191-Number of 1 Bits
entry.content:
Problem Description:

Write a function that takes an unsigned integer and returns the number of ’1’ bits it has (also known as the Hamming weight).

For example, the 32-bit integer ’11’ has binary representation 00000000000000000000000000001011, so the function should return 3.

题目大意：

写一个函数，返回某一数字二进制表示中1出现的次数

Solutions:

利用位运算中&操作符号，和指定数的每一位都单独&一次，如果是1，则会返回1，再使用一个计数器实现统计。

Code in C++:

class Solution {
    public:
        int hammingWeight(uint32_t n) {
            int count=0;
            for(int i=0;i<32;i++)
                if(n&1<<i) count++;

            return count;

    }
};
entry.summary: Problem Description:

entry.title: Leetcode-338-Counting Bits
entry.content:
Problem Description:

Given a non negative integer number num. For every numbers i in the range 0 ≤ i ≤ num calculate the number of 1’s in their binary representation and return them as an array.

Example:
For num = 5 you should return [0,1,1,2,1,2].

Follow up:

It is very easy to come up with a solution with run time O(n*sizeof(integer)). But can you do it in linear time O(n) /possibly in a single pass?
Space complexity should be O(n).
Can you do it like a boss? Do it without using any builtin function like __builtin_popcount in c++ or in any other language.

题目大意：

输入一个数字，输出从0开始到该数字为止的所有数字二进制表示中1的个数.

Solutions:

对于最基本的解题思路，如果使用O(n*sizeof(integer))的时间的话,可以写一个统计某个数之中出现“1”的次数的函数，正如这一题，然后从0开始循环调用N次。
但是我们通过观察二进制的规律不难发现，除了2的整数次幂只有一个1以外，每多一位，立马会从0开始到这个数字为止全部重复一次。动态规划转移方程为a[n]=1(如果n为2的整数次幂)，a[n]=1+a[mark] （mark为我们的标记）我们用两个标记变量，一个表示2的整数次幂，另一个表示已经循环到的数字，每次经过2的整数次幂后，该标记归0。这样便能把时间复杂度降低为O(n)，而且只用使用O(n)的额外空间。

Code in C++:

class Solution {
    public:
        vector<int> countBits(int num) {
            vector<int> res(num+1);
            if(num==0) return res;
            else {

                res[0]=0;
                int power=1;
                int mark=1;
                for(int i =1;i<=num;i++)
                    {
                        if(i==power)
                            {
                                    res[i]=1;
                                    power<<=1;
                                    mark=1;
                            }else
                        {
                              res[i]=1+res[mark];
                              mark++;
                        }
                    }
                }
            return res;

    }
};
entry.summary: Problem Description:

entry.title: Leetcode-344-Reverse String
entry.content:
Problem Description:

Write a function that takes a string as input and returns the string reversed.

Example:
Given s = “hello”, return “olleh”.

题目大意：

反转一个给定字符串

Solutions:

简单的倒序添加每一个字符即可

Code in C++:

class Solution {
public:
    string reverseString(string s) {
        string res="";
        for(int i = 0; i<s.length();i++)
        res=s[i]+res;

        return res;
    }
};
entry.summary: Problem Description:

entry.title: Leetcode刷题记录84-Minimum Path Sum
entry.content:
Problem Description:

Given a m x n grid filled with non-negative numbers, find a path from top left to bottom right which minimizes the sum of all numbers along its path.

Note: You can only move either down or right at any point in time.

Solutions:

A simple 2D dynamic programming problem

Code in C++:

class Solution {
    public:
        int minPathSum(vector<vector<int>>& grid) {
            int m=grid[0].size();
            int n=grid.size();
            int solution[n][m];
            solution[0][0]=grid[0][0];
            for(int i=1;i<m;i++)
                solution[0][i]=solution[0][i-1]+grid[0][i];
            for(int j=1;j<n;j++)
                solution[j][0]=solution[j-1][0]+grid[j][0];

            for(int j=1;j<n;j++)
                for(int i=1;i<m;i++)
                    solution[j][i]=min(solution[j-1][i],solution[j][i-1])+grid[j][i];

            return solution[n-1][m-1];

    }
};
entry.summary: Problem Description:

entry.title: Leetcode刷题记录83-Swap Nodes in Pairs
entry.content:
Problem Description:

Given a linked list, swap every two adjacent nodes and return its head.

For example,
Given 1->2->3->4, you should return the list as 2->1->4->3.

Your algorithm should use only constant space. You may not modify the values in the list, only nodes itself can be changed.

Solutions:

exchange every pair. remember to keep the pre of next pair.

Code in C++:

/**
 * Definition for singly-linked list.
 * struct ListNode {
 *     int val;
 *     ListNode *next;
 *     ListNode(int x) : val(x), next(NULL) {}
 * };
 */
class Solution {
    public:
        ListNode* swapPairs(ListNode* head) {
            if(!head||!head->next) 
                return head;
            ListNode * a= head;
            ListNode * b= a->next;
            ListNode * newhead =b;
            ListNode* pre= new ListNode(-1);
            pre->next=head;
            while(b&&a)
                {
                    a->next=b->next;
                    b->next=a;
                    pre->next=b;
                    pre=a;
                    a=a->next;
                    if(a)
                    b=a->next;
                    else break;
                }
            return newhead;
       }
};
entry.summary: Problem Description:

entry.title: Leetcode刷题记录82-Sort Colors
entry.content:
Problem Description:

Given an array with n objects colored red, white or blue, sort them so that objects of the same color are adjacent, with the colors in the order red, white and blue.

Here, we will use the integers 0, 1, and 2 to represent the color red, white, and blue respectively.

Note:
You are not suppose to use the library’s sort function for this problem.

click to show follow up.

Follow up:
A rather straight forward solution is a two-pass algorithm using counting sort.
First, iterate the array counting number of 0’s, 1’s, and 2’s, then overwrite array with total number of 0’s, then 1’s and followed by 2’s.

Could you come up with an one-pass algorithm using only constant space?

Solution 1:

A typical counting sort problem.

Code in C++ for Solution 1:

class Solution {
    public:
        void sortColors(vector<int>& nums) {
            int numof0=0;
            int numof1=0;
            int numof2=0;
            for(int i=0;i<nums.size();i++)
                {
                    switch(nums[i])
                        {
                            case 0 : numof0++;break;
                            case 1 : numof1++;break;
                            case 2 : numof2++;break;
                            default: break;
                           }
                   }
            for(int i=0;i<numof0;i++)
                nums[i]=0;
            for(int j=0;j<numof1;j++)
                nums[j+numof0]=1;
            for(int k=numof0+numof1;k<nums.size();k++)
                nums[k]=2;

        }
};

Solution 2:

Using two pointers to seprate those parts.

Code in C++ for Solution 2:

class Solution {
    public:
        void sortColors(vector<int>& nums) {
            int indexof0=0;
            int indexof2=nums.size()-1;
            int i=0;
            while(i<=indexof2)
                {
                    if(nums[i]==0)
                        {
                            swap(nums[i],nums[indexof0]);
                            indexof0++;
                            i++;
                        }
                    else if(nums[i]==2)
                        {
                            swap(nums[i],nums[indexof2]);
                            indexof2--;
                        }
                    else i++;
            }

    }
};
entry.summary: Problem Description:

entry.title: Leetcode刷题记录81-Best Time to Buy and Sell Stock
entry.content:
Problem Description:

Say you have an array for which the ith element is the price of a given stock on day i.

If you were only permitted to complete at most one transaction (ie, buy one and sell one share of the stock), design an algorithm to find the maximum profit.

Solutions:

This problem is very similar to This problem.Just change the array into the change array.

Code in C++:

class Solution {
    public:
        int maxProfit(vector<int>& prices) {
            if(prices.empty()) 
                return 0;
            int change[prices.size()];
            change[0]=0;
            for(int i=1;i<prices.size();i++)
                change[i]=prices[i]-prices[i-1];
            int res=INT_MIN;
               int sum=0;
            for(int i=0;i<prices.size();i++){
                sum= sum>=0? sum+change[i]:change[i];
                res=max(res,sum);
        }
            return res;
    }
};
entry.summary: Problem Description:

entry.title: Leetcode刷题记录80-Unique Paths
entry.content:
Problem Descriptions:

A robot is located at the top-left corner of a m x n grid (marked ‘Start’ in the diagram below).

The robot can only move either down or right at any point in time. The robot is trying to reach the bottom-right corner of the grid (marked ‘Finish’ in the diagram below).

How many possible unique paths are there?

Solutions 1:

Using recursive call. It’s like the Climbing stairs problem.

Code in C++ for Solution 1:

class Solution {
    public:
        int uniquePaths(int m, int n) {
            if(m==1||n==1) return 1;
            else return uniquePaths(m-1,n)+uniquePaths(m,n-1);

    }
};

Solution 2:

Using a map to record the best solutions(using dynamic programming)

Code in C++ for Solution 2:

class Solution {
       public:
           int uniquePaths(int m, int n) {
           int a[m][n];
           for(int i=0;i<m;i++)
                a[i][n-1]=1;
           for(int i=0;i<n;i++)
               a[m-1][i]=1;
           for(int i=m-2;i>=0;i--)
               for(int j=n-2;j>=0;j--)
                   a[i][j]=a[i+1][j]+a[i][j+1];
           return a[0][0];
        }
    };
entry.summary: Problem Descriptions:

entry.title: Leetcode刷题记录79-Find Minimum
entry.content:
Problem Description:

Suppose a sorted array is rotated at some pivot unknown to you beforehand.

(i.e., 0 1 2 4 5 6 7 might become 4 5 6 7 0 1 2).

Find the minimum element.

You may assume no duplicate exists in the array.

Solutions:

Using binary search

Code in C++:

class Solution {
    public:
        int findMin(vector<int>& nums) {
            int begin =0;
            int end = nums.size()-1;
            int mid =begin+(end-begin)/2;
            if(nums[end]>nums[begin]) return nums[begin];
            while(end-begin>1)
                {
                    if(nums[mid-1]>nums[mid])
                        return nums[mid];
                    else if(nums[mid]<nums[begin])
                        {
                            end = mid ;
                            mid = begin + (end-begin)/2;
                        }
                    else if (nums[mid]>nums[begin])
                        {
                            begin = mid;
                            mid = begin + (end-begin)/2;
                        }
                }
            return min(nums[end],nums[begin]);

        }
};
entry.summary: Problem Description:

entry.title: Leetcode刷题记录78-Convert Sorted Array to Binary Search Tree
entry.content:
Problem Description:

Given an array where elements are sorted in ascending order, convert it to a height balanced BST.

Solutions:

Do it recursively. use mid element to be the root.

Code in C++:

/**
 * Definition for a binary tree node.
 * struct TreeNode {
 *     int val;
 *     TreeNode *left;
 *     TreeNode *right;
 *     TreeNode(int x) : val(x), left(NULL), right(NULL) {}
 * };
 */
class Solution {
    public:
        TreeNode* sortedArrayToBST(vector<int>& nums) {
            vector<int> a;
            vector<int> b;
            int mid=nums.size()/2;
            for(int i=0;i<mid;i++)
            a.push_back(nums[i]);
            for(int i=mid+1;i<nums.size();i++)
            b.push_back(nums[i]);
            if(nums.size()==0) 
                return NULL;
            else if(nums.size()==1)
                {
                    TreeNode* t= new TreeNode(nums[0]);
                    return t;
                }
            else
                {
                       TreeNode* root =new TreeNode(nums[mid]);
                       root->left= sortedArrayToBST(a);
                       root->right=sortedArrayToBST(b);
                       return root;
                }
        }
    };
entry.summary: Problem Description:

entry.title: Leetcode刷题记录77-Maximum Subarray
entry.content:
Problem Descriptions:

Find the contiguous subarray within an array (containing at least one number) which has the largest sum.

For example, given the array [−2,1,−3,4,−1,2,1,−5,4],
the contiguous subarray [4,−1,2,1] has the largest sum = 6.

Solutions:

Once the sum is less than 0, start from the current element.

Code in C++:

class Solution {
    public:
        int maxSubArray(vector<int>& nums) {
            int res=INT_MIN;
            int sum=0;
            for(int i=0;i<nums.size();i++){
                sum= sum>=0? sum+nums[i]:nums[i];
                res=max(res,sum);
            }
        return res;
    }
};
entry.summary: Problem Descriptions:

entry.title: Leetcode刷题记录76-Integer to Roman
entry.content:
Problem Description:

Given an integer, convert it to a roman numeral.

Input is guaranteed to be within the range from 1 to 3999.

Solutions:

Like coin pick problems, just use greedy algorithm

Code in C++:

class Solution {
    public:
        string intToRoman(int num) {
            string res="";
            int a[13]={1000,900,500,400,100,90,50,40,10,9,5,4,1};
            string x[13]={"M","CM","D","CD","C","XC","L","XL","X","IX","V","IV","I"};
            for(int i=0;i<13;i++)
                {
                    if(num>=a[i])
                        {
                            for(int j=0;j<num/a[i];j++)
                                res+=x[i];
                                num%=a[i];
                        }
                }
            return res;

        }
    };
entry.summary: Problem Description:

entry.title: Leetcode刷题记录75-Search Insert Position
entry.content:
Problem Description:

Given a sorted array and a target value, return the index if the target is found. If not, return the index where it would be if it were inserted in order.

You may assume no duplicates in the array.

Here are few examples.
[1,3,5,6], 5 → 2
[1,3,5,6], 2 → 1
[1,3,5,6], 7 → 4
[1,3,5,6], 0 → 0

Solutions:

Using binary search

Code in C++:

class Solution {
    public:
        int searchInsert(vector<int>& nums, int target) {
            int begin =0;
            int end = nums.size()-1;
            int mid = begin+(end-begin)/2;
            while(end-begin>1)
                    {
                    if(nums[mid]==target) 
                        return mid;
                    else if(nums[mid]>target)
                        {
                            end=mid;
                            mid=begin+(end-begin)/2;
                            continue;
                        }
                    else if(nums[mid]<target)
                        {
                            begin=mid;
                            mid=begin+(end-begin)/2;
                            continue;
                        }
                }
            if(target<=nums[begin])return begin;
            if(target>nums[end]) return end+1;
            return end;

    }
};
entry.summary: Problem Description:

entry.title: Leetcode刷题记录74-Unique Binary Search Tree
entry.content:
Problem Description:

Given n, how many structurally unique BST’s (binary search trees) that store values 1…n?

For example,
Given n = 3, there are a total of 5 unique BST’s.

1 3 3 2 1
\ / / / \ \
3 2 1 1 3 2
/ / \ \
2 1 2 3

Solutions:

A unique binary search tree using i as root in n nodes are (0~i-1) in the left and (i+1~n) in the right. So we can do a dynamic programming.

Updates:
You can see from here . This kind of number is called “Catalan number”.

Code in C++:

class Solution {
    public:
        int numTrees(int n) {
            int res[n+1]={0};
            res[0]=1;
            res[1]=1;
            for(int i=2;i<=n;i++)
                    for(int j=0;j<i;j++)
                      res[i]+=res[j]*res[i-1-j];
            return res[n];
    }
};
entry.summary: Problem Description:

entry.title: Leetcode刷题记录73-Missing Number
entry.content:
Problem Description:

Given an array containing n distinct numbers taken from 0, 1, 2, …, n, find the one that is missing from the array.

For example,
Given nums = [0, 1, 3] return 2.

Note:
Your algorithm should run in linear runtime complexity. Could you implement it using only constant extra space complexity?

Solution 1:

If we have O(n) extra space. we can mark every appeard element.

Code in C++ for Solution 1:

class Solution {
    public:
        int missingNumber(vector<int>& nums) {
            bool flag[nums.size()+1];
            for(int i=0;i<nums.size();i++) 
                flag[i]=false;
            for(int i=0;i<nums.size();i++)
                flag[nums[i]]= true;
            for(int i=0;i<nums.size();i++)
                if(!flag[i]) return i;
            return nums.size();

    }
};

Solution 2:

We can add the total number and minus every element.

Code in C++ for Solution 2:

class Solution {
    public:
        int missingNumber(vector<int>& nums) {
            int res=nums.size();
            for(int i=0;i<nums.size();i++)
                res += (i-nums[i]);
            return res;

    }
};

Solution 3:

Use Bit Manipulation(which I don’t know very well)

Code in C++ for Solution 3:

class Solution {
    public:
        int missingNumber(vector<int>& nums) {
            int res = 0;
            for (int i = 0; i < nums.size(); ++i) {
                res ^= (i + 1) ^ nums[i];
        }
            return res;
    }
};
entry.summary: Problem Description:

entry.title: Leetcode刷题记录72-Populating Next Right Pointers in Each Node
entry.content:
Problem Description:

Given a binary tree

struct TreeLinkNode {
  TreeLinkNode *left;
  TreeLinkNode *right;
  TreeLinkNode *next;
}

Populate each next pointer to point to its next right node. If there is no next right node, the next pointer should be set to NULL.

Initially, all next pointers are set to NULL.

Note:

You may only use constant extra space.
You may assume that it is a perfect binary tree (ie, all leaves are at the same level, and every parent has two children).
For example,
Given the following perfect binary tree,
1
/ \
2 3
/ \ / \
4 5 6 7
After calling your function, the tree should look like:
1 -> NULL
/ \
2 -> 3 -> NULL
/ \ / \
4->5->6->7 -> NULL

Solutions:

It’s very like This Problem

Code in C++:

 /**
 * Definition for binary tree with next pointer.
 * struct TreeLinkNode {
 *  int val;
 *  TreeLinkNode *left, *right, *next;
 *  TreeLinkNode(int x) : val(x), left(NULL), right(NULL), next(NULL) {}
 * };
 */
class Solution {
    public:
        void connect(TreeLinkNode *root) {
            queue<TreeLinkNode*> a;
            if(root)
                {
                    TreeLinkNode* pre=NULL;
                    a.push(root);
                    a.push(NULL);
                    while(!a.empty())
                        {
                            TreeLinkNode* t=a.front();
                            a.pop();
                            if(t)
                                {
                                    if(t->left)
                                        a.push(t->left);
                                    if(t->right)
                                        a.push(t->right);
                                    if(pre) 
                                        pre->next = t;
                                    pre=t;                                 
                                }
                            else{
                                    if(!a.empty())
                                        {
                                            a.push(NULL);
                                            if(pre) 
                                                pre->next=NULL;
                                            pre=NULL;
                                        }
                                }

                        }
                }

        }
    };
entry.summary: Problem Description:
